sen.j: 西吉野温泉（にしよしのおんせん）は、奈良県五條市西吉野町城戸（旧西吉野村）（旧国大和国）にある温泉。
sen.e: Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring is the hot spring which is located in Jodo, Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishi-yoshino Village) (Yamato Province, old province).
Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring is a hot spring which is located in Jodo, Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishi-yoshino Village) (Yamato Province, old province).
sen.cmt: is the hot spring → is a hot spring
sen.e: Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring is a hot spring which is located in Jodo, Nishiyoshino Town, Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishi-yoshino Village) (Yamato Province, old province).

sen.j: 車 ：五條市中心部（本陣交差点＝国道24号、国道168号、国道310号交点） から国道168号を十津川方面へ南下。
sen.e: By car: Take National Route 168 from the Central part of Gojo City (Honjin Crossing = the point of intersection of National Route 24, 116 and 310) and go south toward Totsu-kawa River.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: By car: Take National Route 168 from the Central part of Gojo City (Honjin Crossing = the point of intersection of National Route 24, 118 and 310) and go south toward Totsu-kawa River.
By car: Take National Route 168 from the Central part of Gojo City (Honjin Crossing: the point of intersection of National Route 24, 118 and 310) and go south toward Totsu-kawa River.
sen.cmt: イコール記号を コロンに変更

sen.e: It takes approximately 30 minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It takes approximately 30 minutes.
It takes approximately 30 minutes.

sen.j: 城戸交差点で奈良県道20号下市宗桧線を下市方面へ。
sen.e: At Kido Crossing, take Nara Prefectural Road No.20 Shimoichi Munehi Route toward Shimoichi City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At Kido Crossing, take Nara Prefectural Road No.20 Shimoichi Munehi Route toward Shimoichi City.
At Kido Crossing, take Nara Prefectural Road No.20 Shimoichi Munehi Route toward Shimoichi City.
It takes approximately 3 minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It takes approximately 3 minutes.
It takes approximately 3 minutes.

sen.j: バス：西日本旅客鉄道和歌山線五条駅 (奈良県)から奈良交通西吉野温泉（専用道城戸経由）ゆきバスで約30分、もしくは十津川方面ゆき（城戸行き、新宮駅行きなど）バスで約30分、城戸停留所下車徒歩約20分。
sen.e: By bus: Take the Nara Kotsu Bus Lines bound for Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring (limited highway via Jodo) from West Japan Railway Company - Wakayama Line Gojo Station (Nara Prefecture) for approximately 30 minutes, or take the bus bound for Totsu-kawa River (for Jodo, Shingu Station, etc.) for approximately 30 minutes and a 20-minute walk after getting off at Kido bus stop.

By bus: Take a bus of the Nara Kotsu Bus Lines bound for Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring (via Jodo on the bus-dedicated road) from Wakayama Line Gojo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (Nara Prefecture) for approximately 30 minutes, or take the bus bound for Totsu-kawa River (for Jodo, Shingu Station, etc.) for approximately 30 minutes and a 20-minute walk after getting off at the Kido bus stop.

By bus: Take a bus of the Nara Kotsu Bus Lines bound for Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring (via Jodo on the bus-dedicated road) from Wakayama Line Gojo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (Nara Prefecture) for approximately 30 minutes, or take the bus bound for Totsu-kawa River (for Jodo, Shingu Station, etc.) for approximately 30 minutes and a 20-minute walk after getting off at the Kido bus stop.

sen.j: ナトリウム - 塩化物泉
sen.e: Salt spring
Salt spring
Salt spring

sen.j: 数件の温泉宿、公営の宿泊施設「にしよしの荘」および公営の日帰り温泉施設「セミナーハウスきすみ館」がある。
sen.e: There are a few hot-spring hotels, public accommodation facility "Nishiyoshi no So Inn" and public day visit hot spring "Seminar House Kisumikan."
There are a few hot-spring hotels, public accommodation facility "Nishiyoshi no So Inn" and public day visit hot spring "Seminar House Kisumikan."
There are a few hot-spring hotels, public accommodation facility 'Nishiyoshi no So Inn' and public day visit hot spring 'Seminar House Kisumikan.'

sen.j: 西吉野温泉の歴史は古く、南北朝の時代には、吉野へと向かわれる途中の天皇が立ち寄られ、旅の疲れを癒されたということが伝わっている。
sen.e: Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring has a long history, and in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), it is said that the Emperors stopped in to get rid of travel fatigue on their way to Yoshino.

Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring has a long history, and it is said the in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the Emperors stopped in to get rid of travel fatigue on their way to Yoshino.
sen.cmt: 時制の調整（it is said の場所変更）
sen.e: Nishiyoshino Onsen Hot Spring has a long history, and it is said the in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the Emperors stopped in to get rid of travel fatigue on their way to Yoshino.

sen.j: 幕末の頃から温泉宿がいくつか並び、街道を往来する旅人の良い宿場となっていた。
sen.e: Since the end of Edo Period, a few hot-spring hotels have stood in a row and become good posting stations for travelers who came and went main highway.
Since the end of Edo Period, a few hot-spring hotels have stood in a row to be a good posting station for travelers coming in and going out on the road.
Since the end of Edo Period, a few hot-spring hotels have stood in a row to be a good posting station for travelers coming in and going out on the road.
